column4: I installed lucid, but my system freezes randomly and my caps/scroll lock light blink repeatedly. Has anyone experienced this?
caps/scroll lock light blink repeatedly <<<< that's a kernel panic. review the logs /var/log/messages
problem is, I got nothing in my logs :( i checked messages, syslog, kernel.log...
well if the kernel panic is severe enough the kernel may be unable to writte anything to disk ...
have you checked hardware ? memtest =?
I could try alt+sysrq+REISUB, but the problem happens randomly. I have done a full test on my hd with the utility provided by samsum and i'm gonna do a memtest
it seems like i'm not alone http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1470452 :(
another thing you can do if you really want to track this dwon is set up netconsole (advanced kernel debugging yay!! ) http://www.mjmwired.net/kernel/Documentation/networking/netconsole.txt
thanks, this seems a bit advanced, i could study the documentation and try.
good luck
thanks for the hint on netconsole, it was easier than i thought. Anyway I reinstalled, disabled the sata controller, and it seems to work fine so far
ok glad it helped
somewhat at least ....
i'm keeping an eye on the output of netconsole on this machine, if it freezes again let's hope i can catch it

I was able to see the error: http://paste.ubuntu.com/431208/ it happens when i copy big files from a sata drive to a pata drive. with the sata controller disabled it seem to work fine ... i checked my hardware, i think it's a kernel problem :(
report the issue either in launchpad against the ubuntu kernel. or directly to the kernel devs in the linux kernelmailing list. include the backtrace you captured. mention that is reproducible
ok

I reported the bug yesterday https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/578401 but maybe i've already found a solution. i've compiling mplayer and md5summing 200gb of data at the same time and it's working so far
i'm glasd you "fixed" it (or workaround it anyway)
thanks for your help.
no problem
